title: Hit by Op Sindoor, panic-stricken Pak mounted frantic lobbying in US
content: Following India's military retaliation against a terror attack, Pakistan urgently sought US mediation to halt New Delhi's strikes.  FARA filings reveal Islamabad's frantic lobbying efforts, involving over 60 contacts with US officials and media.  Pakistan's hired firm, Squire Patton Boggs, aimed to secure American intervention to "somehow halt" India's operations, indicating significant behind-the-scenes panic.

title: National shooting coach suspended after minor accuses him of sexual harassment
content: India's shooting coach Ankush Bhardwaj has been suspended by the National Rifle Association of India (NRAI) following a sexual harassment accusation by a minor shooter. An FIR has been filed against Bhardwaj, who was recommended by the NRAI for a coaching role post-Paris Olympics. The incident reportedly occurred last month after a training session.

title: 'Slow down? That’s not fast bowling': The belief that shaped Mitchell Starc
content: Mitchell Starc’s Ashes heroics capped a series that underlined both his durability and evolution. As the left-armer moves closer to the game’s all-time highest wicket-takers, his childhood coach Neil de Costa recalls the defining philosophy that shaped Starc’s career: bowl fast, swing hard and ignore anyone who tells you otherwise.

title: Gen Z uprising in Pakistan? PhD student's article challenges those in power — why it was taken down
content: A PhD student's article, "It is over," critically examining Pakistan's ruling establishment and Gen Z's disillusionment, sparked widespread debate. The piece, later removed from publication, argued that young Pakistanis see through imposed patriotism and demand justice and opportunity, signaling a potential shift from quiet discontent to open resistance.

title: Gemini gains, ChatGPT slips: Google AI CEO ‘admits’; Co made OpenAI send ‘code red’
content: Google's Gemini is rapidly gaining ground on ChatGPT, showing significant month-over-month growth and capturing a substantial portion of its rival's audience. This surge has prompted OpenAI to issue an internal 'code red' warning, as Google's integrated infrastructure and full-stack approach appear to be giving it a decisive edge in the competitive AI chatbot landscape.

title: BJP-AIMIM tie-up in Akot collapses hours after CM Fadnavis warning
content: An alliance between BJP and AIMIM in Akola's Akot town collapsed within hours after CM Devendra Fadnavis warned of action. The state BJP issued a show-cause notice to Akot MLA Prakash Bharsakale for promoting the arrangement without party consultation. A new front, 'Akot Nagar Vikas Manch', formed with support from multiple parties, claimed majority.

title: Sportsmanship debate: 'Kids look up to him' - Carlsen's outbursts cast shadow over chess
content: Magnus Carlsen's repeated emotional outbursts, including slamming boards and scattering pieces, have sparked debate about sportsmanship in elite chess. While FIDE prioritizes commercial success, critics argue that unaddressed behavior sends the wrong message to young players who idolize the world champion.

title: Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk humorously noted China's rapid adoption of his energy ideas, from EVs and solar to massive battery production. He highlighted China's dominance in these sectors, contrasting it with US potential. Musk emphasized batteries, like Tesla's Megapacks, as crucial for doubling US energy throughput without new power plants, especially for AI's growing demands.

title: Silver slides Rs 10k on MCX: March 2026 future prices fall nearly 3%; what's the outlook?
content: Silver prices experienced a significant drop of Rs 10,000 on Thursday, with March 2026 futures plummeting. This sharp correction follows December's record high, signaling market instability. HSBC forecasts a gradual decline in silver prices over the next few years, citing weakening industrial and jewelry demand, despite a projected deficit. Increased mining output also contributes to the bearish outlook.

title: Rahila Firdous' journey: Engineering degree, keeping gloves & Dhoni as idol | EXCLUSIVE
content: Bhopal-born cricketer Rahila Firdous, inspired by Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni, has earned an engineering degree while honing her cricket skills. After impressive domestic performances, she was picked by Mumbai Indians for Rs 10 lakh in the WPL auction, a significant career leap. Rahila is eager to learn from skipper Harmanpreet Kaur and leverage the WPL platform for growth.

title: 'Completely wrong': Microsoft executive shutdown shuts down layoff rumours
content: Microsoft has vehemently denied widespread layoff rumors, with a top executive calling reports of up to 22,000 job cuts "completely false." Speculation, fueled by past workforce reductions and a significant AI investment, suggested cuts across Azure, Xbox, and sales. However, the company insists these claims are entirely fabricated, aiming to quell anxieties about its future workforce.

title: Khawaja Asif says Pakistan may not need IMF loans soon — what's behind the claim
content: Pakistan's defence minister claims a surge in aircraft orders, potentially ending IMF reliance within six months. This follows a military standoff with India and discussions with Bangladesh and Saudi Arabia for JF-17 fighter jet deals. The Pak minister expressed strong confidence in these orders materializing, suggesting a significant boost to Pakistan's economy.

title: Delhi: 3 days after motorist fell off Wazirpur flyover, another critically injured
content: Two men have fallen from the Wazirpur flyover in Delhi within three days, with one fatality and another critically injured. Police suspect an engineering defect due to a one-foot gap between carriageways and inadequate barriers. They are writing to the concerned agency to examine structural flaws and have recommended speed breakers and barriers.

title: 'Amazing recovery': Damien Martyn discharged; thanks cricketing world for the love
content: Former Australian cricketer Damien Martyn is on the mend after a serious health scare involving meningitis, which led to him being hospitalised and placed in an induced coma.  He has now been discharged and is recovering at home, expressing gratitude for the outpouring of support from the cricketing community.  His journey continues, but his progress is described as amazing.

title: Schoolgirl gangraped in Kanpur: YouTuber arrested, sub-inspector absconding
content: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly abducted and gang-raped in Kanpur, leading to the arrest of a YouTuber and a manhunt for an absconding sub-inspector. Police Commissioner Raghubir Lal removed a Deputy Commissioner and suspended the local SHO for alleged lapses and distortion of facts. The victim's family reported initial police inaction and a cover-up attempt.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection: Ranveer Singh starrer nears Rs790cr
content: ‘Dhurandhar’ has achieved a historic fifth weekend, raking in Rs. 33.25 crore and pushing its Hindi net collection past ₹781 crore. This Aditya Dhar directorial is now set to break ‘Pushpa 2’s record, a remarkable feat achieved solely through its Hindi version, unlike other Rs. 1000-crore club members. The film's consistent performance defies typical box office trends, solidifying its all-time blockbuster status.

title: Maduro’s ouster: Venezuela says 100 killed ‘in cold blood’ US strike
content: Venezuela's interior minister reported 100 deaths during a US military operation that ousted President Nicolás Maduro, who was wounded. Meanwhile, the US seized two Venezuela-linked oil tankers, including a Russian-flagged vessel, as part of intensified efforts to enforce sanctions on Caracas's oil shipments.

title: 'No WC at the cost of dignity': B'desh draws firm line; pushes ICC to shift matches to SL
content: Bangladesh's government has hardened its stance on playing the T20 World Cup in India, citing national dignity and cricketer security concerns. Dhaka will urge the ICC to relocate their matches to Sri Lanka, believing the global body misunderstands the gravity of the situation. Participation will not come at the cost of humiliation or compromised safety.

title: 'Raped, killed and set on fire': Semi-naked charred body of woman found dumped in Hapur sugarcane field
content: Sensation prevailed in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur district after the burnt, semi-naked body of a woman, aged around 30, was recovered from a sugarcane field behind brick kilns in Lahadra village under the Bahadurgarh police station area, police said here on Thursday.

title: Late-night demolition drive sets off clashes near old Delhi
content: A demolition drive by MCD near Faiz-e-Ilahi Mosque in Turkman Gate led to stone-pelting and clashes, injuring five policemen. Authorities used tear gas and deployed drones to control the situation and identify suspects. Five individuals have been arrested for their involvement in the incident.

title: Video: US ICE officer shoots woman at point-blank range in Minneapolis — how it unfolded
content: An ICE officer fatally shot a woman driving an SUV during an immigration raid in Minneapolis. US President Trump called the incident "horrible" and labeled the woman a "professional agitator" who "viciously" ran over the officer. The administration confirmed the shooting, stating the woman attempted to run over law enforcement.

title: Big blow for india: Tilak Varma undergoes surgery, ruled out of New Zealand T20Is
content: A significant setback for India's T20 World Cup preparations, middle-order batter Tilak Varma has suffered an abdominal injury requiring surgery.  The 23-year-old's potential absence from the upcoming T20I series and the mega event next month opens doors for a T20 comeback for Shreyas Iyer. Varma's crucial role in the Asia Cup final is highlighted.

title: Toxic teaser out: Yash debuts as gangster Raya - here's the release date
content: Kannada star Yash returns with 'Toxic: A Fairy Tale for Grown-Ups', a gangster action drama set in 90s Goa. The recently released teaser showcases Yash as the menacing Raya, introducing a dark and intense narrative. The film, directed by Geetu Mohandas, features a star-studded cast and is slated for a March 19, 2026 release.

title: JJ Watt net worth in 2025: endorsements, investments, car collection and more
content: JJ Watt's remarkable NFL career saw him become a three-time Defensive Player of the Year and the first to achieve two 20-sack seasons.  His 12-year journey, marked by resilience and leadership, concluded with the Arizona Cardinals.  Beyond his $129 million in NFL salary, Watt amassed significant wealth through endorsements and investments.

title: ‘I forget’: Haryana man who has son after 10 daughters struggles to recall children’s names
content: Haryana showcases its gender paradox with contrasting births: a daughter celebrated with a traditional son's ritual, while an 11th son was welcomed after 10 daughters, highlighting both progress and persistent son preference. Despite awareness campaigns, deep-rooted bias remains evident in the state's transition.

title: WTC standings after Ashes: Australia tighten grip, England slip; India stay in contention
content: Australia solidified their WTC lead with a dominant Ashes win, while England's struggles continue, impacting their standings. This shift offers India a glimmer of hope, as they sit sixth and can capitalise on England's slide. The race for the WTC final is heating up with New Zealand, South Africa, and Sri Lanka also in contention.

title: Pune: Renowned ecologist Madhav Gadgil passes away at 83
content: Renowned ecologist Madhav Gadgil, celebrated for his work on the Western Ghats, passed away in Pune at the age of 83. He was honored by the UN in 2024 with the Champions of the Earth award for his significant contributions to the region's conservation. Gadgil also led a government panel studying the ecological impacts on the Western Ghats.

title: Bihar: SUV rams multiple vehicles near Gola Road in Patna, 4 injured; locals set car ablaze
content: An SUV rammed into roadside vehicles in Danapur, Patna, injuring four people, including a woman. Locals set the vehicle ablaze, which was later controlled by the fire brigade. The driver remains unidentified as the license plate was destroyed, but the owner is being traced via the engine number.

title: 500% tariffs ahead for India & China? Trump clears Russia sanctions bill; what it means
content: The Trump administration is threatening to penalize countries buying discounted Russian oil, a move that could impact India's energy imports and trade with the US. A bipartisan sanctions bill, approved by Trump, aims to pressure nations like India, China, and Brazil to cease Russian crude purchases, which the US argues funds Putin's war in Ukraine.

title: Four students die in car crash after hitting tree post birthday party
content: Four BBA students died in a high-speed car accident in Mokila late Wednesday night after a birthday celebration. The SUV carrying five students, including the birthday boy Sumit, collided with a tree while travelling towards Narsingi. One student, Nakshatra, survived with injuries. Authorities are investigating if drunk driving was a contributing factor.

title: ‘How many doctors are there’: Sreeleela asks in an arts college
content: Actress Sreeleela experienced a humorous moment during 'Parasakthi' promotions in Kochi when she asked an arts college audience about doctors. Realizing her gaffe, she, along with co-stars Sivakarthikeyan and Ravi Mohan, burst into laughter. The lighthearted incident quickly went viral online, drawing amusing reactions from netizens. The film, directed by Sudha Kongara, marks Sreeleela's Tamil debut.

title: Forever layoff: Ongoing small-scale cuts erode job security
content: Forever layoff captures a quiet shift in modern work: Layoffs that never end, only repeat. Through Dickens’s fact-driven Coketown and Kafka’s unfinished trial, this analysis traces how endless uncertainty reshapes mindspace, productivity, trust, and power at work. Jobs remain, but assurance disappears. Careers no longer progress or conclude. They linger, alert, provisional, and permanently under review.

title: Who was Agnivesh Agarwal? Anil Agarwal’s son & Vedanta Group director passes away at 49
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi mourned the sudden passing of Vedanta Group director Agnivesh Agarwal, 49, who died of cardiac arrest after a skiing accident in the US. Agarwal, son of Anil Agarwal, was recovering well before the tragedy. He was a respected leader, sportsman, and musician, deeply committed to India's self-reliance and societal welfare.

title: Winter break 2026: Delhi schools closed amid cold wave as per DoE academic calendar
content: Delhi schools will remain shut until January 15, adhering to the Directorate of Education's winter vacation schedule for the 2025-26 academic year. This decision aims to protect students from harsh winter conditions. However, some parents have voiced concerns on social media about private institutions reopening early, urging authorities to ensure uniform adherence to the break.

title: Gold & silver price prediction today: Will gold & silver touch new record highs in coming days? Here's the outlook
content: Gold and silver price prediction: Abhilash Koikkara, Head - Forex & Commodities at Nuvama Professional Clients Group is of the view that gold and silver prices are touching new record highs and this is a phase of consolidation.

title: IT ministry calls Musk’s X reply ‘inadequate,’ demands action plan on Grok AI issue
content: India's IT Ministry has expressed concerns over obscene content generated by Elon Musk's chatbot Grok, demanding X (formerly Twitter) provide specific actions and preventive measures. The ministry seeks documented proof of compliance with IT rules and content standards, rejecting generic assurances from the social media platform.

title: Sewage in drinking water in Greater Noida: Several fall ill with vomiting, diarrhoea
content: Dozens of Greater Noida residents, including children, fell ill with vomiting, diarrhea, and fever after sewage contaminated the drinking water supply in Sector Delta 1. Authorities have repaired a leaking pipeline and distributed medicines, while residents fear a repeat of past tragedies and demand better infrastructure.

title: Enna thambi! 'You can't explain this at 14': Ashwin's awe sums up Sooryavanshi's rise
content: Fourteen-year-old batting sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi is making waves in cricket with astonishing performances.  Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin highlighted his recent scores, calling his talent inexplicable.  Sooryavanshi recently captained India U19 to a series win against South Africa with a century, showcasing his immense potential ahead of the U19 World Cup.

title: Quote of the day from Bhagavad Gita: 'Mind can be your greatest friend, or your worst enemy"
content: Lord Krishna's profound teaching from the Bhagavad Gita highlights the mind's dual nature: a powerful ally or a formidable foe. He emphasized that a disciplined, calm mind attracts positivity, while an uncontrolled one becomes a significant obstacle. Training the mind through meditation, self-discipline, detachment, and consistent practice is key to harnessing its potential and making it a true friend.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex below 84,950
content: Stock market today: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, crashed in trade on Thursday. While Nifty50 went below 25,950, BSE Sensex dropped over 650 points.

title: India defends antitrust penalty law in Apple fight
content: In November, Apple asked New Delhi judges to strike down the 2024 law, which could also have implications for global giants such as Pernod Ricard, Publicis, Amazon and other foreign companies

title: Rare January system over Bay of Bengal set to bring heavy rainfall to parts of T.N.
content: The Bay of Bengal has witnessed only 20 intense weather systems during January since 1891, making such events unusual during this time of the year

title: New six-lane bridge across Phalguni at Kulur likely to be commissioned by end of May 2026
content: Pier caps for all six but one pier is complete with the Authority expecting to launch girders at the earliest

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin launches distribution of Pongal gift hampers
content: These gift hampers, each comprising one kilogram of raw rice, one kilogram of sugar and one full sugarcane along with ₹3,000 in cash, will be distributed over five days till January 12, 2026

title: ‘Savukku’ Shankar threatening witnesses, cancel his interim bail: T.N. police urge Madras High Court
content: Justices P. Velmurugan and M. Jothiraman grant time for his mother to file a counter affidavit to the bail cancellation plea by the police

title: ED searches I-PAC office in Kolkata; Mamata alleges agency tried to seize TMC’s internal data
content: Leader of Opposition in West Bengal Assembly Suvendu Adhikari terms Mamata’s visit to I-PAC chief Pratik Jain’s house as “unconstitutional and interference” in the central agency’s probe

title: Congress leaders criticise delay of censor board clearance for Vijay’s Jana Nayagan
content: Referring to her experience as a former member of the censor board, Karur MP Jothimani said the CBFC has become outdated in the present technological era and that it is increasingly being used as a political tool.

title: Driving test candidates turn first aid and CPR trainees at Hyderabad RTA
content: Anyone assisting an accident victim has the right to choose whether to be an eyewitness or not, Assistant Motor Vehicles Inspector Sai Karthik

title: Ahead of U.S. Ambassador arrival, Trump okays 500% tariff Bill on Russian oil; withdraws from India-led ISA
content: U.S. Ambassador-designate Sergio Gor, who takes charge on January 12, 2026 has said ending India’s Russian oil imports is a “top priority”

title: Anbumani’s alliance talks with AIADMK illegal: PMK founder Ramadoss
content: PMK leader said he has been authorised by the General Council and the Executive Council to decide on electoral alliances. The party’s laws empower the founder as the sole decision-maker, added Mr. Ramdoss.

title: Anbumani flags steep decline in tapioca prices, urges T.N. govt. to fix procurement price
content: In a statement, he said the price has dropped from about ₹16,000 per tonne two years ago to around ₹4,700 per tonne now, and has severely affected farmers in districts such as Salem, Namakkal, Erode, and Dharmapuri

title: Major setback for India's green cause: Kharge on Madhav Gadgil's demise
content: Gadgil leaves behind an enduring imprint on research, teaching, and ecological conservation, and his departure is a major setback for the country's green cause, Mr. Kharge said

title: Vijay’s ‘Jana Nayagan’, the last to court trouble, not the first
content: For Jana Nayagan, Vijay’s political message is clear: “I am coming.” However, fans will have to wait for his arrival on screen, and it might be delayed — possibly for the last time

title: Mananchira-Vellimadukunnu road to be completed by February: Minister Mohammed Riyas
content: Minister Riyas said efforts were on to address the alleged negligence on the part of the contractors in speeding up the NH widening works in the Vadakara stretch

title: Steps needed to boost enrolment in government schools in Karnataka: Minister Madhu Bangarappa
content: The Minister stated that the introduction of LKG and UKG classes, and the launch of bilingual-medium schools had already led to an increase in enrolment, and officials must build on this momentum

title: Bombay High Court to hear PIL alleging mass rejection of BMC poll nominations
content: The petition alleges a pattern favouring the ruling party and demands ward‑wise speaking orders and calls on SEC to restore nominations and bar rejections for defects deemed curable

title: Madhav Gadgil (1942-2026)
content: Renowned ecologist Madhav Gadgil passed away on January 7, 2026. We take a look at how his work made an impact in the country.

title: National shooting coach accused of sexually harassing minor in Faridabad; suspended by NRAI
content: Ankush Bhardwaj, a former pistol shooter, had served a doping ban in 2010 for the use of a beta-blocker during his competitive days

title: Operation resumes in Kathua to track down terrorists; one security person injured
content: The joint action by the Special Operations Group of J&K Police and other security forces was launched at Kahog village in Billawar on January 7th evening, leading to an encounter, says official

title: From heading Western Ghats panel to helping establish world class centres in IISc, Madhav Gadgil had a long association with Karnataka
content: Madhav Gadgil headed the Western Ghats Ecology Expert Panel, also known as the Gadgil Committee, which made several recommendations to safeguard the fragile Western Ghats

title: RDPR Department considering Singapore technology to ensure water quality in Karnataka
content: The Minister told representatives of Singapore-based ZWEEC that a pilot project would be taken up to study the solutions on offer

title: In Ambarnath, Shiv Sena in opposition, BJP joined by suspended Congress corporators
content: A letter issued by the Collector of Thane, accessed by The Hindu, grants recognition to the ‘Ambarnath Vikas Aghadi’ group

title: Domicile certificates not valid for SIR hearings in Bengal: Official
content: The list of acceptable documents under the SIR include permanent address or residence certificates issued by the State, but domicile certificates do not fall under this category

title: 2026 to see upswing in India-E.U. relationship: Jaishankar in Luxembourg
content: Mr. Jaishankar met Prime Minister Luc Frieden, had a long, detailed discussion with Foreign Minister Javier Bethel, and called on Guillaume V, the Grand Duke of Luxembourg

title: Unusual January system brews over Bay of Bengal; heavy rain likely across parts of T.N.
content: An orange alert has been issued to Thiruvarur and Nagapattinam as heavy to very heavy rainfall is possible on Friday

title: Schoolgirl gangraped in Kanpur; YouTuber nabbed, hunt on for cop
content: The case has triggered high-level administrative action, with Police Commissioner Raghubir Lal removing Deputy Commissioner of Police (West) Dinesh Chandra Tripathi and suspending Sachendi Station House Officer (SHO) Vikram Singh for alleged lapses and distortion of facts

title: Kondapalli railway station to be developed with ₹10 crore
content: The Central government has approved the deveopment project under Amrit Bharat 2.0 scheme, says Vijayawada MP

title: U.S. tariff impact: India is finding newer markets, strengthening old trade routes to compensate
content: India has replaced its lost U.S. sales by deepening its ties with existing partners and exploring new destinations

title: All set for Amaravati Avakaya Festival in Vijayawada from January 8
content: The three-day event will feature film screenings, literary discussions, poetry readings, music and dance performances, theatre shows, workshops, cultural lectures and contemporary art exhibitions

title: Congress party is not by or for individuals: Priyank Kharge
content: Congress chief Kharge continued his tirade against the RSS after a special court issued notices to him and other Congress leaders in a defamation case

title: Karnataka urges Kerala Governor to reject Malayalam language Bill
content: Karnataka Border Area Development Authority, in its petition, has demanded that Kasargod, where more than 70% of the population is Kannada speaking, be excluded from the purview of the bill

title: Jabarkhet: can private reserves restore wildlife and keep tourism gentle?
content: Private reserves are popular in Africa. In India, however, responsible private reserves are more about potential than reality. In dissecting how wildlife returned to Jabarkhet Nature Reserve and how it has balanced tourism needs with conservation, it is possible to trace a model for private reserves in India

title: Fishermen seek special camps for updation of addresses in official records
content: The issue has arisen for families who moved from huts to apartments constructed by the Slum Clearance Board too

title: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee slams BJP over migrant workers’ ordeal when detained in Maharashtra
content: The two workers detained over allegations of being Bangladeshi nationals were from Balurghat constituency, which is led by BJP MP and Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar

title: Protests erupt outside Bengal’s health department as ASHA workers demand pay hike, benefits
content: The demands include increased monthly honorarium, life insurance benefits, maternity leave, recognition as permanent government employees among others

title: Radha Nagar subway in Chromepet finally opened
content: The facility was planned way back in 2006, and the foundation stone too was laid, as a pedestrian-only facility to enable residents of East Chromepet to access the  Grand Southern Trunk (GST) Road

title: Bihar Govt. spent over ₹3,630 crore on development schemes under MMKVY in five years: Minister
content: Corpus of Mukhya Mantri Kshetra Vikas Yojana increased from ₹3 crore to ₹4 crore; 1108 of 2456 schemes have been completed till November 2025

title: Chennai Corporation to reassess women’s safety perceptions in city’s public spaces and transport
content: The upcoming midline study would adopt a mixed-method approach and will be conducted across all 15 zones of Chennai and major transit points

title: CM Nitish orders Bihar officials to hear public grievances at their offices two days a week
content: The CM asserted that a register of complaints received from visitors will be maintained, instructions have been given to all concerned officials to make this arrangement effective from January 19

title: SASTRA University, The Hindu Education Plus to organise webinar on research and innovation
content: The session would offer students insights into research-oriented career options, interdisciplinary innovation, and national science initiatives

title: Vedanta chairperson Anil Agarwal's son Agnivesh dies in U.S. at 49
content: The Board member of a Vedanta group firm got injured in a skiing accident and was recovering when he died of a cardiac arrest

title: Jharkhand to debut at World Economic Forum to be held in Davos
content: Chief Minister Hemant Soren will lead the 11-member delegation from January 18 to 26; visit coincides with 25 years of Jharkhand’s statehood

title: Maharashtra Congress vice-president dies of stab wounds in Akola
content: Main accused held, IPS officer to head probe, say police; Hidayatullah Patel was stabbed at a mosque in Akola district

title: ‘Divine connect’ through Money Order prevails over digital currency
content: Launched in 2009, ‘Aseervachanam’ scheme is still popular in the era of UPI transactions as the TTD received ₹3.1 crore as donations through M.O. from 1.26 lakh devotees in 2025

title: Rogue elephant kills 13 in two days in Jharkhand villages
content: Teams of forest officials with experts from West Bengal's Bankura district have been engaged to drive away the elephant back to the forest

title: Mysuru resident loses ₹1.77 crore to trading app fraud
content: When he wanted to withdraw his funds, the fraudsters demanded that he pay ‘capital gains tax on private accounts’

title: For-profit companies allowed to set up medical colleges under PPP mode, says NMC chief
content: As hospitals run under PPP mode will be under the purview of State governments,  patients will get treatment on either free or subsidised basis, says Abhijat Chandrakant Sheth

title: Chief Minister Naidu seeks statutory protection for Amaravati as Andhra Pradesh’s capital
content: Seeking introduction of the relevant Bill in Parliament, he tells Amit Shah that it is crucial for the State’s development and stability

title: Alienation in Kashmir touches unprecedented level, Omar prefers silence: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Mufti accused the current dispensation in J&K under Omar Abdullh of failing to address the burning issues of people

title: NCB seized 1.33 lakh kg of drugs worth about ₹2,000 crore in 2025
content: During the year, the agency also busted six drug laboratories operating in Rajasthan, Maharashtra, West Bengal, and Madhya Pradesh

title: A.P. govt. opens ‘net-zero’ residential school at Kuntamukkala near Vijayawada
content: The pilot project aims to serve as a scalable model of an Integrated Ecological Campus which will include green belts, rainforest, wetlands, and microgreens

title: Man electrocuted on illegal electrical fence near Arakkonam; farmer held
content: Police said that the farmer had reportedly erected illegal electrical fencing around the farmland to prevent wild animals from damaging crops during night

title: Vijay’s ‘Jana Nayagan’ postponed; new release date to be announced soon
content: Earlier in the day, the Madras HC had reserved orders on a writ petition filed by the film’s producer against the non-issuance of the censor certificate by the Central Board of Film Certification

title: Farmers seek release of water from Sathanur dam in Tiruvannamalai on January 14 for irrigation
content: While water from the dam’s Left Bank Canal feeds 30 tanks in Tiruvannamalai and 10 in Villupuram, the Right Bank Canal is connected to 48 tanks in Villupuram

title: AICC observers for poll-bound States
content: D.K. Shivakumar, Bhupesh Baghel and Bandhu Tirkey have been appointed for Assam; Sachin Pilot, Kanhaiya Kumar, Imran Pratapgarhi, K.J. George are observers for Kerala

title: Elections to five standing committees in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation postponed
content: Only the welfare, town planning and tax appeal standing committees were formed in the elections held on Wednesday.  Tactical deployment of councillors to capture control of certain standing committees led to a lack of quorum in others. BJP manages majority in town planning standing committee, despite R.Sreelekha’s vote becoming invalid due to her failure in noting her name and signature on  ballot paper

title: Assam BJP leader Kabindra Purkayastha dies at 94
content: The former Union Minister laid the foundation of the party in the northeast and was one of the key drivers of its growth in Assam, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma says

title: Tamil Nadu Government orders probe into ED’s corruption allegations linking Minister K.N. Nehru
content: The DVAC has launched a detailed inquiry into the alleged bribery in the award of contracts in MAWS department

title: CM Stalin hits out at Amit Shah for ‘slandering’ DMK
content: Criticising the Union Home Minister for accusing the DMK government of working against the beliefs of Hindus, he pointed out that it had performed the consecration of over 4,000 temples

title: Central drug regulator releases guidelines to compound minor drug violations
content: The move will aid business compliance, exempting pharma firms from appearing in court in case of “certain minor contraventions”; instead, they will have to pay a fine and take “self-corrective actions”

title: Supreme Court defers Sonam Wangchuk detention case hearing by a day
content: The move will enable Justice P.B. Varale to read the case records of a challenge launched by Dr. Gitanjali J. Angmo against the Centre for detaining her husband and climate activist Sonam Wangchuk under the National Security Act.

title: Centre moves to restore popular govt. in Manipur, holds review meets
content: Government conducts two security meetings in a week, discusses “pros and cons” of extending President’s Rule, and security deployment in Manipur; Kuki-Zo groups opposed to government formation, remain firm on demand for separate administration

title: Public protests, scarcity of land hampering setting up of dog shelters, says Kerala govt.
content: The Revenue and Local Self-Government departments are in the process of identifying suitable land for new shelters. Once the land is finalised, the Animal Husbandry department will provide technical support for setting up the facilities

title: Minister raps BIAL over Bengaluru airport’s pick-up, parking regulations
content: During the inspection, the Minister also noticed that a portion of the bus bays earmarked for Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) Vayu Vajra airport buses had been taken over, triggering sharp criticism from him

title: Simple language in stories a conscious decision to reach more people: Banu Mushtaq
content: Interestingly, the Booker prize winner dictates poems and short stories to a voice-to-text software in her phone, often when she is travelling, as her work as a lawyer and an activist leaves her little time to sit down and put pen to paper

title: Congress to place legal teams in every district; they will be our eyes and ears: Singhvi
content: The Congress will also constitute a ‘Rapid response force’ of leading lawyers in each State. These teams will be tasked with promptly taking court cases involving the party

title: Grading the Trae Young trade: How did the Hawks and Wizards fare?
content: Trae Young is headed from the Hawks to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert. Which team fared best? We graded the trade.

title: Sources: Hawks end Young era, send G to Wiz
content: The Hawks are trading four-time All-Star Trae Young to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert, sources said.

title: Chiefs 'aware' of abuse allegations by Rice's ex
content: The Chiefs acknowledged Wednesday that they are aware of domestic violence allegations made by a woman who is the ex-girlfriend of Rashee Rice, with the team saying it's in communication with the league and will have no additional comment at this time.

title: Jim Harbaugh hails John, hopes he's NFC-bound
content: Jim Harbaugh doesn't expect his older brother John to be out of a job very long but just hopes his next landing spot isn't in the AFC, where the Chargers reside. "As I told him, whatever team he goes to is going to be formidable," Jim said.

title: Spurs' Sochan: 'Polite exchange' with Vanderbilt
content: Spurs forward Jeremy Sochan downplayed the severity of a postgame incident Wednesday that involved Lakers forward Jarred Vanderbilt poking him in the face.

title: Lipsey touted as best PG in nation after ISU win
content: Iowa State coach T.J. Otzelberger declared Tamin Lipsey the nation's best point guard after he led the Cyclones past Baylor and to the first 15-0 start in program history Wednesday night.

title: Scheffler to make '26 debut at American Express
content: World No. 1 Scottie Scheffler will make his 2026 debut at the American Express Championship later this month, tournament officials said Wednesday night. Scheffler also has committed to the WM Phoenix Open.

title: Sources: Rockies, Lorenzen agree to $8M contract
content: Right-hander Michael Lorenzen and the Rockies are in agreement on a one-year, $8 million contract that includes a club option, sources told ESPN.

title: HOF goalie Hall, who started 502 in a row, dies
content: Glenn Hall, a Hockey Hall of Famer whose streak of 502 consecutive starts as a goaltender remains an NHL record, has died. He was 94.

title: 🏈 Our latest NFL mock draft predicts Picks 1-32

content: The Kings fired Mike Brown this time last season, but one year later don't seem any closer to finding their way.

content: This year's playoffs will feature three superior defenses: the Texans, Broncos and Seahawks. What makes each so unstoppable?

content: The Big Ten is guaranteed to be playing for a third straight national title. Can the SEC find a way to dominate this new era like it did the previous one?

content: After the tumult of Ruben Amorim's dismissal, Darren Fletcher and United's 2-2 draw vs. Burnley was fittingly dramatic.

content: Chelsea could have given up a penalty to Fulham, but the VAR stuck with the on-field decision. Was it the right call?

title: Amber Glenn is finally ready for her Olympic moment
content: This week, Amber Glenn looks to defend her back-to-back national titles -- and become the oldest U.S. Olympic women's singles skater in 98 years.

content: Texas Tech, one of four unbeaten teams left in women's D-I, and Baylor enter the top 16 as UNC and Notre Dame exit.

content: The quarterback's grill came from a collaboration of his mom, wife, former Clemson teammate and the Jaguars social media team.

content: A 2011 Vikings sack that NFL officials changed a call on seemed to work in Browns' defensive end's favor.

content: Whether Manchester United aim to hire quickly or wait until summer, here are the coaches they could be after.

title: 'Not Every Stray Dog To Be Removed': Supreme Court Clarifies Order
content: The Supreme Court said that it has not directed for every dog to be removed from the streets, adding that they should be treated according to rules.

title: Bihar Man Dies, Son Suffers Eye Damage After Consuming Spurious Liquor
content: A 60-year-old man died after consuming spurious liquor, while his son suffered partial loss of eyesight in Bihar's Samastipur district, an official said on Thursday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Five Questions About Money to Ponder in 2026
content: Stablecoins had their ChatGPT moment in 2025. Payment tokens that were until now used mostly by crypto traders are raring to go mainstream, and not just in the US, where they got regulatory blessing through the Genius Act.

title: Maduro's 'Perfect Union' With China Hides Deep Economic Rupture
content: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro may have done more to hollow out China's presence in his economy than Donald Trump ever could.

title: Rs 1,800 Crore Plan Cleared To Boost High-Security Paper For Banknotes
content: The government has approved a Rs 1,800 crore proposal to increase the production of high-security paper used for printing currency notes, a move aimed at strengthening Indias currency infrastructure and reducing import dependence.

title: Delhi Wakes Up To Chilling 5.8 Degrees Celsius, 3rd Lowest This Season
content: A biting chill swept through the national capital on Thursday morning, as Delhi woke up to its lowest minimum temperature recorded this year, and the third lowest for the season, at 5.8 degrees Celsius

title: After Indore, Several Fall Ill In Greater Noida. Reason: Contaminated Water
content: Several residents of Greater Noidas Delta 1 Sector fell ill after allegedly consuming contaminated drinking water, prompting health concerns and complaints of sewage mixing with the supply line, officials and residents said.

title: US Says It Will Control Venezuela Oil Exports Indefinitely
content: The Trump administration plans to control future sales of Venezuelan oil and hold the proceeds in US accounts, Energy Secretary Chris Wright said, making the clearest statement yet on Washington's strategy.

title: UP Cops Dig Out Skeleton Buried 10 Months Back, And Uncover Chilling Crime
content: At 11 pm yesterday, most of Kanpur was preparing to sleep. But at Tikwapur village, a group of cops and workers was braving the chills for what would lead to a startling discovery

title: Colombia Looks to Turn the Page With US After Petro-Trump Call
content: Colombia expects tensions with the US to ease and cooperation on drug trafficking to strengthen following an hour-long phone call between Donald Trump and Gustavo Petro, a senior Colombian diplomat said later on Wednesday.

title: Meet Ryan Chen, The Viral 'Chinese Trump' Impersonator With Huge Following
content: Outstretching his hands in a signature Donald Trump pose, impersonator Ryan Chen mimics the US president's voice and gestures with such accuracy that he has become a social media phenomenon with his funny videos.

title: Meet Tina Shah, Indian-Origin Physician Competing In New Jersey House Race
content: Tina Shah was born to immigrants in the United States. She is triple board-certified in internal medicine, pulmonary medicine, and critical care medicine.

title: OpenAI's ChatGPT Health Can Be Linked With Medical Records, Wellness Apps
content: OpenAI on Wednesday launched a ChatGPT Health tab that answers healthrelated questions and lets users upload medical records and connect wellness apps such as Apple Health and MyFitnessPal.

title: Mount Etna Guides Protest Over Restrictions After Volcano Eruption
content: Guides who take tourists to enjoy the striking views of Sicily's Mount Etna are up in arms over tougher restrictions imposed by local authorities after a round of eruptions at the giant volcano in recent weeks.

title: Video: Iranian Cop Chased In Car, Shot Dead Amid Anti-Khamenei Protests
content: As protests over economic distress paralyse Iran's law and order situation, a video has emerged showing a cop being killed by unknown assailants in a drive-by shooting in the southeastern province of Sistan and Baluchestan.

title: Wife Can't Be Presumed To Be Earning At Interim Maintenance Stage: Delhi High Court
content: Wife cannot be presumed to be earning or being capable of maintaining herself at the stage of granting interim maintenance, the Delhi High Court has said.

title: Woman Shot Dead By US Immigration Agent Was A Poet And Mother Of 3
content: A US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent shot dead a woman in Minneapolis on Wednesday, officials said. Renee Nicole Good, 37, a resident of the Twin Cities, was shot a few blocks from her home.

title: A "No Congress Without Siddaramaiah" Remark, Then Priyank Kharge's Rebuttal
content: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge has asserted that the Congress's success cannot be attributed to any single leader, emphasising instead its 140-year organisational legacy.

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.
